Posts.Content: Motherbeartosix wrote: I haven't had my lumpectomies yet, but based on two stereotactic biopsies, I have DCIS in right breast, and ADH in left breast. How does having both affect my future risk factors? Or if I had DCIS in both breasts (a possibility), how does that affect my future risk factors? (Trying to decide at what point I would have masectomies.) When I talked to my doctor, we discussed my risk based on the DCIS. Is the risk the same or more? DCIS, grade 2-3, SNB 3/3 neg, ER+, PR+, surgery 9/20/07 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Question about risk Motherbeartosix Indigoblue

Posts.Content: Motherbeartosix wrote: I have an appt with my breast surgeon on Friday. This morning is the first morning I truly feel bummed out, but I think it's the after effects of general anethesia. I always get this way after general. Then I'll have my lumpectomy on my right breast in about two weeks, unless this left breast proves more troublesome, in which case I have to decide whether or not I want to go straight to masectomy. I HATE MAKING DECISIONS. I've been fine with the knowledge that I have ADH and DCIS, and haven't freaked at all. Now, I'm depressed. So bummed. DCIS, grade 2-3, SNB 3/3 neg, ER+, PR+, surgery 9/20/07 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for excisional biopsy results Motherbeartosix lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Motherbeartosix wrote: And here it is day eleven, and I am visibly more swollen today. Before, I could raise both of my arms, turn a bit, and see that my right side was just bigger. . However, I just checked because I'm so sore, and there is a visible "mound" around the scar. It's worse. Is this normal for eleven days? And what should I do to find some relief? Thursday, my surgeon said it looked fine for one week after surgery, but now it's definitely worse. The swelling isn't huge, but it's more defined. Does this make any sense? I had DCIS, and opted to keep my breast, so not very much tissue was even taken. Thanks for your help. This is my first time venturing to this board, but I thought you gals would be the most knowledgeable. Jo DCIS, grade 2-3, SNB 3/3 neg, ER+, PR+, surgery 9/20/07 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Only 3 nodes removed during SNB Motherbeartosix geebung

Posts.Content: Motherbeartosix wrote: I have DCIS grades 2-3 in my right breast, and am having a lumpectomy on my left breast for ADH. I'm wondering if anyone here had a surprise on their lumpectomy tissue. I've just taken all of this in stride, but will be so upset if it's cancer in both breasts. What are the chances of that? Jo DCIS, grade 2-3, SNB 3/3 neg, ER+, PR+, surgery 9/20/07 Log in to post a reply
